metadata.title: CVE-2020-11565 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.6.2.mpol_parse_str in mm/mempolicy.c has a stack-based out-of-bounds writebecause an empty nodelist is mishandled during mount option parsing, akaCID-aa9f7d5172fa. NOTE: Someone in the security community disagrees thatthis is a vulnerability because the issue “is a bug in parsing mountoptions which can only be specified by a privileged user, so triggering thebug does not grant any powers not already held.”.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required
